intro: Sabicea laurentii, commonly known as the Laurentian sabicea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, hard pods that contain several seeds. Sabicea laurentii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth.
